comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
The SUNBEAM in July 1887 ?
See comments and links here - she was a fascinating ship -

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons/8052244035/in/photostream/]

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: The plot thickens ... This seems to be EXACTLY the same image as one in the PhM by Henry King 'Lord Brassey's Yacht "SUNBEAM" ' !! Spot the differences - from.ph/459217

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Aha! Same same! Even the flags are rippling the same. This looks to me like another 'photo of a photo' that often pops up in images that are part of the Hall collection. Heny King AND SUNBEAM confirmation. A good day :)
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons] That makes sense - this version is missing the writing and a length of rope along the bottom of the King image.  There seem to be a lot of coincidences with the two photographers - similar subjects at similar times etc.

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/pellethepoet/] might know more ...

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Ours looks to be a cropped version, there is a man visible near the centre mast (in front of the life boat) and another figure in white disappearing around the foremast. The two rowers also appear to be raising their arms at the exact same time. Either King & Hall were snapping in the same spot same time - or we have ourselves a copy!
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: On a side note - spotted in the collection: a lovely copy of Lady Brassey's book
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons] Looks like the book is in French. How wonderful!  I bet you have the book of the ST GEORGE hidden away somewhere too.

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] ... or might not. But I'm sure they would have known each other. It was a small, if competitive, community. What I can say is that Hall [I assume Jr.?], who was press photographer for the Leader, knew the other press photographer's of the day: George Bell (Sydney Mail) [he of the panorama], G. Hills (Town and Country Journal), J. Eastman (Australasian), W. Liddy (the Field), and the freelance press photographers Lionel Lindsay [yes him!], D. Fry, H. M. Somers and J. Bain. How do we know? They attended a press photographers' dinner at the Royal Easter Show in 1908. - source: Australasian Photo-Review, 21 May 1908, p. 179 cited in Anne-Marie Wills, Picturing Australia : A History of Photography (Sydney : Angus and Robertson), p. 105.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
